feature: Deploy danieltarazona.com to Cloudflare Pages with DNS Configuration
workflow_rationale: This is a new infrastructure deployment task that establishes production hosting and DNS configuration for the website. While no application code changes are required, it represents a new feature in the project's infrastructure - making the website publicly accessible at its production domain. The task involves multiple infrastructure components (GitHub Actions, Cloudflare Pages, Cloudflare DNS, Namecheap) that must be configured in sequence.
description: Deploy the Astro-based danieltarazona.com portfolio website to Cloudflare Pages using the existing GitHub Actions workflow, then configure DNS routing through Cloudflare DNS with domain registered at Namecheap.

verification.instructions: Push a commit to main/master branch OR use GitHub Actions 'Run workflow' button to trigger deployment. Verify workflow completes successfully with green checkmark. Check workflow logs to confirm 'Deploy to Cloudflare Pages' step succeeds.

phases.name: Create Cloudflare DNS Zone
phases.description: Create DNS zone for danieltarazona.com in Cloudflare dashboard and obtain nameserver addresses

subtasks.description: Add danieltarazona.com domain to Cloudflare account

verification.instructions: In Cloudflare Dashboard → Websites → Add a Site, enter 'danieltarazona.com'. Select Free plan. Cloudflare will scan existing DNS records (if any). Confirm the domain appears in your Cloudflare account dashboard.

subtasks.notes: This creates a new DNS zone in Cloudflare for the domain. Cloudflare may detect existing DNS records from Namecheap if nameservers haven't been changed yet.

verification.instructions: After adding the domain, Cloudflare displays two nameserver addresses (e.g., ada.ns.cloudflare.com and phil.ns.cloudflare.com). Document these nameservers - they will be needed for Namecheap configuration in Phase 4.

subtasks.notes: Cloudflare assigns specific nameservers to each domain. These must be entered exactly as shown at Namecheap. Typical format: firstname.ns.cloudflare.com and secondname.ns.cloudflare.com.

phases.name: Configure DNS Records in Cloudflare
phases.description: Configure A/AAAA and CNAME DNS records to point danieltarazona.com to Cloudflare Pages deployment

subtasks.description: Add custom domain to Cloudflare Pages project

verification.instructions: In Cloudflare Dashboard → Workers & Pages → danieltarazona-com → Custom domains → Set up a custom domain. Enter 'danieltarazona.com' (apex domain). Cloudflare will automatically create the necessary DNS records.

subtasks.notes: Cloudflare Pages can automatically configure DNS records when you add a custom domain to the project. This is the recommended approach as it ensures correct record types (A/AAAA for IPv4/IPv6 or CNAME as appropriate).

subtasks.description: Add www subdomain to Cloudflare Pages project

verification.instructions: In Cloudflare Pages custom domains, add 'www.danieltarazona.com' as a second custom domain. Cloudflare will create a CNAME record for www pointing to the apex or Pages deployment.

subtasks.notes: Adding www subdomain ensures users can access the site with or without www prefix. Cloudflare handles the redirect to the apex domain automatically.

subtasks.description: Verify DNS records are proxied (orange cloud enabled)

verification.instructions: In Cloudflare Dashboard → DNS → Records, verify that danieltarazona.com (apex) and www.danieltarazona.com records show an orange cloud icon (Proxied status). If showing grey cloud (DNS only), click to toggle to Proxied.

subtasks.notes: Proxied DNS records (orange cloud) enable Cloudflare's CDN, DDoS protection, and SSL. DNS-only mode (grey cloud) bypasses these features. For Cloudflare Pages, proxied mode is required for SSL certificates and CDN.

phases.name: Update Namecheap Nameservers
phases.description: Update domain nameservers at Namecheap to point to Cloudflare's nameservers

subtasks.description: Update nameservers at Namecheap to Cloudflare nameservers

verification.instructions: Log in to Namecheap → Domain List → danieltarazona.com → Manage → Nameservers. Select 'Custom DNS' and enter the two Cloudflare nameservers obtained in Phase 2. Save changes. Confirm Namecheap shows 'Custom DNS' with Cloudflare nameservers listed.

subtasks.notes: CRITICAL STEP: This makes Cloudflare the authoritative DNS provider for the domain. Once changed, all DNS queries for danieltarazona.com will be resolved by Cloudflare. Changes may take 24-48 hours to propagate globally but often complete within a few hours.

Use dig or nslookup to check nameserver propagation. Initial propagation to major DNS resolvers (Google 8.8.8.8, Cloudflare 1.1.1.1) often completes within 1-2 hours. Full global propagation can take 24-48 hours.

phases.name: Configure SSL/TLS Settings
phases.description: Enable Cloudflare SSL/TLS in Full mode and configure HTTPS redirect

verification.instructions: In Cloudflare Dashboard → SSL/TLS → Overview, select 'Full' mode (NOT Flexible). This ensures encrypted connection between Cloudflare and Cloudflare Pages origin. Verify the SSL/TLS encryption mode shows 'Full'.

subtasks.notes: SSL/TLS modes: Flexible (insecure, avoid), Full (encrypts Cloudflare↔origin, use this), Full (Strict) (requires valid cert on origin, may fail with Pages). Cloudflare Pages provides automatic SSL on origin, so 'Full' mode is appropriate.

verification.instructions: In Cloudflare Dashboard → SSL/TLS → Edge Certificates, enable 'Always Use HTTPS' toggle. This automatically redirects all HTTP requests to HTTPS. Test by visiting http://danieltarazona.com (should redirect to https://).

subtasks.notes: This setting creates a 301 redirect from HTTP to HTTPS for all requests. Essential for security and SEO. Also enables HSTS (HTTP Strict Transport Security) when combined with Full SSL mode.

verification.instructions: In Cloudflare Dashboard → SSL/TLS → Edge Certificates, verify 'Active Certificate' status for danieltarazona.com and www.danieltarazona.com. Certificate type should be 'Universal SSL' or 'Cloudflare Managed Certificate'. Wait 1-5 minutes if status shows 'Pending'.

subtasks.notes: Cloudflare automatically provisions free SSL certificates for domains using their nameservers. Certificates are typically issued within 1-5 minutes after DNS propagation begins. If 'Pending' for >10 minutes, verify DNS records are proxied (orange cloud).

phases.name: DNS Propagation & Site Verification
phases.description: Verify DNS propagation globally and confirm site is accessible at production domain with valid SSL

verification.instructions: Check DNS propagation status using https://whatsmydns.net for danieltarazona.com (A record) and nameservers (NS record). Verify at least 80% of global DNS servers show Cloudflare nameservers and A records pointing to Cloudflare IPs. Also check https://dnschecker.org for additional verification.

subtasks.notes: DNS propagation is gradual. Different geographic regions and ISPs cache DNS records for varying durations (TTL-dependent). 80% propagation indicates most users can access the site. 100% propagation may take 24-48 hours.

checks: All images, CSS, and JavaScript load
No mixed content warnings in DevTools console
Browser shows 'Connection is secure' in certificate details

subtasks.notes: This is the primary production domain. All assets must load over HTTPS. If site doesn't load, check DNS propagation status and verify Cloudflare Pages shows domain as active.

subtasks.description: Verify www redirect to apex domain

checks: URL bar shows apex domain (without www)

subtasks.notes: Cloudflare Pages automatically handles www→apex redirection when both domains are added as custom domains. The redirect should be a 301 (permanent) or 308 (permanent, preserves method).

checks: Contains correct URLs with https://danieltarazona.com prefix

subtasks.notes: Astro's @astrojs/sitemap integration automatically generates sitemap at build time. The sitemap should list all pages with the production domain (https://danieltarazona.com) as defined in astro.config.mjs site property.

subtasks.description: Verify SSL Labs grade (optional security check)

verification.instructions: Visit https://www.ssllabs.com/ssltest/analyze.html?d=danieltarazona.com and run SSL test. Verify site receives minimum grade A rating. Check for any configuration warnings or vulnerabilities.

subtasks.notes: SSL Labs performs comprehensive SSL/TLS configuration analysis. Grade A indicates strong encryption and security posture. Cloudflare typically scores A+ with default settings. This is an optional but recommended security verification.

steps: Visit https://danieltarazona.com in multiple browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Safari)
Check GitHub and LinkedIn social links function correctly
Confirm no 404 errors for any resources
Verify page load performance is acceptable (<2 seconds)
Check browser console for any errors or warnings

subtasks.notes: Final comprehensive check across multiple devices and browsers. Ensures the deployment is production-ready and all functionality works as expected.

summary.estimated_duration: 2-4 hours (excluding DNS propagation wait time of 24-48 hours)
summary.key_dependencies: GitHub secrets must be configured before deployment. DNS propagation to Cloudflare nameservers must complete before site is accessible at custom domain.

parallelism.speedup_estimate: Sequential execution required due to dependencies
parallelism.rationale: This is a linear infrastructure deployment process where each phase depends on the previous phase completing successfully. DNS configuration must follow deployment, nameserver update must follow DNS configuration, and SSL configuration requires nameservers to be updated.

acceptance_criteria: GitHub Actions workflow successfully deploys to Cloudflare Pages
Cloudflare DNS zone configured with correct nameservers
DNS records (A/AAAA/CNAME) properly configured with proxy enabled
Site accessible at https://danieltarazona.com with valid SSL
Sitemap accessible and contains production URLs
SSL Labs grade A or higher
